newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: HORSE RACING-DORANS PRIDE IN EMOTIONAL WIN FOR INJURED PARTNER.
newsitem.headline: HORSE RACING-DORANS PRIDE IN EMOTIONAL WIN FOR INJURED PARTNER.

text.p: Ireland's top novice chaser Dorans Pride brought the curtain down on a successful season with an emotional win in the grade one Power Gold Cup at Fairyhouse, County Meath, on Tuesday.

Third in the Gold Cup at Cheltenham in March, Dorans Pride took his career earnings to over 250,000 Irish pounds ($394,000) with his 17th win but on this occasion he was forced to race without his regular partner Shane Broderick.
Broderick, 22, took a heavy fall when riding at Fairyhouse on Monday and was taken unconscious to hospital and later transferred to intensive care, reportedly with spinal injuries.
Latest hospital reports said that Broderick had regained full consciousness overnight.
"This one is for Shane," a visibly upset Tom Doran, the winning owner, said.
There were no cheers of joy and no backs were slapped when Richard Dunwoody, who deputised for Broderick, led Dorans Pride into the winners' enclosure.
"I thought about pulling him (Dorans Pride) out of the race but Shane would have wanted him to run," Tom Doran said.
Dorans Pride, the 7-4 on-favourite, landed the two and a half miles) 4-km) race by five lengths from 3-1 chance Jeffell with Consharon (20-1) well back in third.
